2018-05-27T15:11:24Z: Here's our report on that race. Keep an eye on Autosport and Motorsport.com all afternoon and through the evening for more reaction, and keep your eyes on our live coverage for the Indianapolis 500 in less than an hour: Monaco Grand Prix: Daniel Ricciardo wins despite car problemDaniel Ricciardo survived a reliability scare to hold off Sebastian Vettel and take his second win of the 2018 Formula 1 season in the Monaco Grand Prix
2018-05-27T14:57:31Z: Result: 1 Ricciardo; 2 Vettel; 3 Hamilton; 4 Raikkonen; 5 Bottas; 6 Ocon; 7 Gasly; 8 Hulkenberg; 9 Verstappen; 10 Sainz; 11 Ericsson; 12 Perez; 13 Magnussen; 14 Vandoorne; 15 Grosjean; 16 Sirotkin; 17 Stroll
2018-05-27T14:56:30Z: Ocon keeps Gasly, Hulkenberg and Verstappen at bay to secure sixth.
2018-05-27T14:56:16Z: Vettel takes second, Hamilton completes the podium, and Raikkonen fends off Bottas to the flag.
2018-05-27T14:55:48Z: Daniel Ricciardo wins the Monaco Grand Prix!
2018-05-27T14:55:00Z: Ricciardo starts the final lap with a very comfortable lead.
2018-05-27T14:54:42Z: Vettel falls back by another second - he's 7.4s behind Ricciardo now.
2018-05-27T14:52:48Z: Massive lock-up for Vettel at Mirabeau - showing how much tyre trouble he is in with three laps to go!
2018-05-27T14:52:47Z: Ocon dropped off Raikkonen and Bottas at that restart and now has Gasly, Hulkenberg and Verstappen on the back of him.
2018-05-27T14:52:28Z: Vettel is back up to speed after being very slow for the first lap or so after the VSC. Ricciardo continues to lead by 5.1 seconds.
2018-05-27T14:51:58Z: 1 Ricciardo, 2 Vettel (+5.3), 3 Hamilton +(13.4), 4 Raikkonen (+15.1), 5 Bottas +16.0), 6 Ocon (+18.1).
2018-05-27T14:51:36Z: Gasly now has three laps to hold off Hulkenberg and Verstappen for seventh.
2018-05-27T14:51:12Z: Even better news for Ricciardo - Vettel has no pace now we are back to racing! Five seconds between the top two on lap 75/78.
2018-05-27T14:50:14Z: Vandoorne rejoins between Ricciardo and Vettel - good news for the leader.
2018-05-27T14:49:52Z: Vandoorne makes a nothing-to-lose pitstop for new hypersofts and stays 14th ahead of Grosjean, who'd done the same a few laps earlier.
2018-05-27T14:49:08Z: That crash moves Ericsson, Perez, Magnussen, Vandoorne, Grosjean, Sirotkin and Stroll up to 11th to 17th places.
2018-05-27T14:48:33Z: Replays show Leclerc tried hard to scrub speed off against the barriers but couldn't help slamming into Hartley, who's in the pits and retiring too.
2018-05-27T14:48:18Z: None of the leaders come in to gamble on a pitstop under VSC.
2018-05-27T14:47:37Z: The virtual safety car is deployed.
2018-05-27T14:47:30Z: Hartley appeared to be going slowly towards the chicane and Leclerc suddenly caught him, hit the back of the Toro Rosso and speared down the escape road.
2018-05-27T14:46:58Z: Leclerc hits the back of Hartley into the chicane!
2018-05-27T14:46:54Z: Ocon appears in the mirrors of Bottas. Earlier it seemed like Mercedes was waiting for problems to hit the cars ahead of the Finn and he could possibly win the race from fifth - now he has a Force India trying to relegate him to sixth.
2018-05-27T14:44:18Z: Grosjean pits from 17th and takes on new hypersofts, in a move that looks like a 'why not?' tactic.
2018-05-27T14:43:52Z: Ricciardo is told he shouldn't catch any more backmarkers between now and the end, so he can get back into his rhythm. Lap 70/78.
2018-05-27T14:43:43Z: Ocon's gap to Raikkonen and Bottas in fourth and fifth is now just 2.3s with nine laps left. Ricciardo's slow pace is keeping the field very, very tight.
2018-05-27T14:43:01Z: The leaders' cautious pace means Verstappen is now only 21.8s from Ricciardo. Seven cars between them, though.
2018-05-27T14:42:48Z: It wasn't that long ago we had Bottas six seconds off the lead in fifth. He's 14.4s down now, as he and Raikkonen slip away from the top three. Hamilton's third place looks pretty safe at the moment, providing he can get those tyres to the end.
2018-05-27T14:40:38Z: 1 Ricciardo, 2 Vettel, 3 Hamilton, 4 Raikkonen, 5 Bottas, 6 Ocon, 7 Gasly, 8 Hulkenberg, 9 Verstappen, 10 Sainz.
2018-05-27T14:40:05Z: Gasly does his best lap of the race so far as he continues to hold Hulkenberg and Verstappen off for seventh with 12 laps left.
2018-05-27T14:38:01Z: Sainz picks up his pace before the crowd behind catches him for 10th, stabilising the gap to Hartley at 4.4s for now.
2018-05-27T14:36:59Z: Just 1.3s covers Gasly, Hulkenberg and Verstappen in seventh to ninth now, the back two on pretty new hypersofts, the Toro Rosso on slightly older supersofts.
2018-05-27T14:35:16Z: Hartley is now with 4.4s of Sainz for 10th, and is bringing both Saubers, Perez, Magnussen and Vandoorne along with him.
2018-05-27T14:34:49Z: Verstappen is within 3s of the Gasly/Hulkenberg battle for seventh now.
2018-05-27T14:34:31Z: The gap covering the top five has gone back up to over eight seconds, as Hamilton, Raikkonen and Bottas drop back.
2018-05-27T14:34:24Z: Gasly now has Hulkenberg all over for him for seventh with 16 laps to go.
2018-05-27T14:34:02Z: Stroll makes a third pitstop, takes on some more hypersofts, becomes an even more distant last but can maybe get fastest lap back now.
2018-05-27T14:33:02Z: Verstappen is now only 32s off race-leading team-mate Ricciardo...
2018-05-27T14:32:46Z: Another new fastest lap for Verstappen, a 1m14.260s. 7.3s to Hulkenberg ahead now, with Gasly only just in front of the Renault.
2018-05-27T14:32:23Z: Hartley has noted Toro Rosso's suggestion he chases down Sainz, he's a second quicker than the Renault and gets the gap to 10th down to 6.2s.
2018-05-27T14:31:41Z: Verstappen bangs in a new fastest race lap of 1m14.847s, closing to within 8.9s of Hulkenberg ahead in eighth.
2018-05-27T14:31:20Z: With Alonso out (the only retirement), McLaren's sole car in the Monaco GP is Vandoorne in 16th.
2018-05-27T14:30:58Z: Hulkenberg is now within 2.1s of Gasly for seventh and still lapping a second and a half faster.
2018-05-27T14:29:55Z: Hamilton has indeed dropped back from the leaders as he predicted - he's now 3.7s off the lead. He'll fall into the clutches of Raikkonen and Bottas soon.
2018-05-27T14:29:42Z: Verstappen asks Red Bull to check his gearbox, presumably after the violent kerb trip.
2018-05-27T14:29:30Z: That extra time behind Sainz has been hugely painful for Verstappen, who's now 11.4s behind Hulkenberg.
2018-05-27T14:29:26Z: Ricciardo has edged away to lead by 1.2s now over Vettel.
2018-05-27T14:29:03Z: Sainz reports Verstappen for cutting the chicane... just as Verstappen had reported Sainz a lap earlier... All square?
2018-05-27T14:28:41Z: This time Verstappen goes down the outside into the chicane, has to take to the run-off but turns as tightly as he can, clambers back over the kerbs and emerges ahead in ninth.
2018-05-27T14:28:15Z: A replay shows Verstappen dived at Sainz into the chicane on the last lap. They brushed wheels, Sainz cut the corner and stayed ahead.
2018-05-27T14:27:45Z: Verstappen has a great run at Sainz towards Sainte Devote but there's just no space.
2018-05-27T14:27:15Z: Sainz is still holding off Verstappen for ninth, just inches between them.
2018-05-27T14:26:59Z: Hulkenberg needs to make the most of the hypersofts before they wear. He's a second faster than Gasly ahead in seventh at present, but 5.6s behind.
2018-05-27T14:26:16Z: Just 6.1 seconds cover the top five - Ricciardo, Vettel, Hamilton, Raikkonen, Bottas.
2018-05-27T14:25:40Z: Vettel is just 0.4s behind Ricciardo now - that's as close as it's been at the front.
2018-05-27T14:25:19Z: Now Sainz slows on the Beau Rivage and Hulkenberg sweeps through into eighth. Sainz then slots back onto the line ahead of Verstappen before Massenet. Tidy.
2018-05-27T14:24:53Z: But Sainz stays ahead of Hulkenberg for now...
2018-05-27T14:24:28Z: Dilemma for Renault - does it get the slower Sainz out of Hulkenberg's way as Verstappen attacks them both? All three cars are absolutely together.
2018-05-27T14:23:27Z: Eighth-placed Sainz now has hypersoft-shod marauders Hulkenberg and Verstappen all over him.
2018-05-27T14:23:03Z: Alonso tells McLaren that it was the gearbox that eventually failed. He's parked in the Sainte Devote escape road with smoke from the car's airbox. That moves Gasly, Sainz, Hulkenberg and Verstappen into seventh, eighth, ninth and 10th.
2018-05-27T14:22:23Z: Alonso slows on the pits straight, Gasly cruises past him into seventh. Alonso is complaining of a loss of power and he's out.
2018-05-27T14:20:45Z: Gasly and his relatively new supersofts are all over Alonso for seventh place. The McLaren is on the same tyres but pitted much, much earlier.
2018-05-27T14:20:13Z: The best thing that can happen here for Red Bull is for Mercedes and Ferrari to stalemate each other, with nobody wanting to give up track position. If the cars behind all decided to take another set of tyres in the closing stages, they'd potentially all have a shot at the Red Bull. But Ferrari, sitting second and fourth, is hardly going to blink first, because unless Mercedes pits its cars too, then Ferrari just turns its result into fourth and fifth.
2018-05-27T14:20:07Z: Having another car on new hypersofts right in front of him isn't good news for Verstappen, he needs to clear this Renault quickly.
2018-05-27T14:19:52Z: Hulkenberg has taken on hypersofts too, but he's rejoined only just ahead of Verstappen.
2018-05-27T14:19:22Z: Hulkenberg pits from sixth place, which elevates Ocon, Alonso and Gasly... and Sainz too.
2018-05-27T14:19:02Z: Verstappen takes nearly 2s off Sainz in his first flying lap and is now within 6.9s of the 10th-placed Renault.
2018-05-27T14:18:05Z: With Verstappen out of his way (for now), Gasly puts in his best lap of the day and takes 1.7s off Alonso in a single lap as he chases the eighth-placed McLaren.
2018-05-27T14:17:23Z: Hamilton is now just 1.2s behind Vettel as it continues to close up at the front.
2018-05-27T14:17:08Z: That Hartley queue has spread out quite a bit, he's still got Leclerc tight on his tail for 12th but Ericsson, Perez, Magnussen and Vandoorne behind are stretching out.
2018-05-27T14:16:17Z: So Verstappen is now 11s behind Sainz in 10th but has much faster tyres.
2018-05-27T14:16:00Z: Verstappen gets back out in 11th, ahead of the Hartley queue that he was hoping to avoid. Nicely done, Red Bull.
2018-05-27T14:15:40Z: Red Bull gives Verstappen a set of hypersofts with 30 laps to go, this should be fun...
2018-05-27T14:15:11Z: Hamilton is having a miserable time on his ultrasofts, but he holds third.
2018-05-27T14:14:56Z: Gasly is now right on Verstappen's tail, and does a replay-worthy big leap over the Swimming Pool exit kerbs.
2018-05-27T14:13:46Z: Hulkenberg is doing his best laps of the day so far in sixth place. He's still on the ultrasofts he started the race on 46 laps ago, and is aiming to stay in the top 10 (ahead of team-mate Sainz) when he ultimately pits.
2018-05-27T14:11:51Z: Stroll's taken the best out of those new hypersofts now and is lapping 5s slower than he was a few laps ago, so is back to being slowest on track.
2018-05-27T14:11:28Z: The gap covering the top five cars has dropped from 10 seconds to just eight. Right now you'd suspect Bottas is just going to end up stuck at the back of the Ricciardo train though, on the best tyre but powerless to do anything about the slower cars ahead.
2018-05-27T14:09:41Z: Vettel has dropped back to 1.5s behind Ricciardo, with Hamilton just 2.7s off the lead now. Ricciardo's pace hasn't picked up, so that's Vettel either struggling to stay tucked up behind him, or deciding to back off to look after his tyres.
2018-05-27T14:04:54Z: Another fastest lap from Stroll, a 1m15.322s.
2018-05-27T14:04:24Z: All Stroll has to do now is unlap himself from the entire field and close a one-lap gap to team-mate Sirotkin in 19th then he's in business.
2018-05-27T14:04:01Z: Stroll sets the fastest lap of the race, a 1m15.478s, on brand new hypersofts. He's very, very last but has fresh very soft rubber and nothing to lose.
2018-05-27T14:03:46Z: Hamilton is now 4.6s behind Ricciardo. He's going to be with Ricciardo and Vettel very soon.
2018-05-27T14:03:26Z: Earlier we said 13.5 seconds covers the top five - that gap is now 10 seconds. Bottas has the right tyre, but he either needs to find a way past these cars or hope that the leaders can't get their ultrasofts to the end.
2018-05-27T14:02:46Z: Gasly falls from sixth to 10th. The yet to pit Hulkenberg moves up to sixth, so a relieved Ocon (right behind the Renault right now) is back in line for that posiiton.
2018-05-27T14:02:28Z: Ricciardo's pace continues to drop off - he and Vettel are now lapping at 1m20.0s, and Hamilton is less than six seconds behind. We could end up with Ricciardo leading a five-car queue in the closing stages of this race.
2018-05-27T14:02:13Z: Gasly gets the last of the life out of his hypersofts with a massive lock-up into Rascasse then pits from sixth. He's takes on supersofts.
2018-05-27T14:01:41Z: Right now, Verstappen's in danger of losing a lot of ground if he pits, with not enough of a gap for comfort over the six-car train led by 12th-placed Hartley.
2018-05-27T14:00:46Z: Williams gives Stroll a new set of hypersofts and he rejoins two laps down and a lap away from even 19th-placed team-mate Sirotkin.
2018-05-27T14:00:22Z: Stroll is moving slowly again with another puncture on the front left. He pits and will be even more firmly last if he rejoins.
2018-05-27T13:59:58Z: Verstappen's charge has definitely stalled for now. He's still 10th, 2.3s behind Alonso and lapping slower than the McLaren, which is on new-ish supersofts while Verstappen's done the whole race so far on ultrasofts.
2018-05-27T13:58:54Z: Vandoorne's late-ish pitstop hasn't worked out well for him. He was 13th early on but is now 17th, queuing behind Ericsson, Perez and Magnussen.
2018-05-27T13:58:05Z: Perez urges Force India to tell race control that Ericsson has been cutting the chicane. Perez is down behind the Sauber in 15th after his slow pitstop.
2018-05-27T13:57:57Z: 13.5 seconds cover the top five - Ricciardo, Vettel, Hamilton, Raikkonen, Bottas.
2018-05-27T13:52:48Z: So, if the problem isn't terminal, is it a loss of power that might not be severe enough to allow Vettel to blast by? If Ricciardo's got to nurse a struggling engine home from here, that's huge.
2018-05-27T13:50:12Z: Vettel continues to gain - he's all over the Red Bull now. Is Ricciardo about to be robbed of another Monaco GP victory?
2018-05-27T13:49:47Z: Ricciardo is six tenths slower than Vettel that time around - the gap is down to 0.6 seconds!
2018-05-27T13:48:14Z: Red Bull tells Verstappen not to worry about that downshift glitch as it doesn't think it wll reoccur. Verstappen says his left front tyre, the ultrasoft he started with, isn't looking good.
2018-05-27T13:47:44Z: Very strong run from Gasly so far. He's up to sixth and though he's yet to pit he's kept his hypersofts in shape through to lap 27 already and pulled out a 7.7s gap over Hulkenberg behind.
2018-05-27T13:46:39Z: Perez was running in the top 10 in the first stint, but a sticking rear wheel at his pitstop has hurt him - he's now 15th behind Hartley, Leclerc and Ericsson.
2018-05-27T13:45:45Z: The only drivers still to pit are Gasly and Hulkenberg in sixth and seventh, then Verstappen in 10th. The Red Bull's not quite on Alonso's tail right now.
2018-05-27T13:45:15Z: Ricciardo is reminded that his main job right now is looking after his tyres, which explains why he's let Vettel close in to only 1.5 seconds behind.
2018-05-27T13:44:51Z: Hartley is given a 5s penalty for pitlane speeding. That's likely to be added to his race time, and right now he's 12th with Leclerc just a second behind him.
2018-05-27T13:43:54Z: Ocon pits, dropping from sixth to eighth behind Gasly and Hulkenberg, who are yet to stop.
2018-05-27T13:42:21Z: Vettel four tenths quicker than Ricciardo on lap 22. Is this the race leader letting the Ferrari close up, or does he not have a choice in the matter at the moment?
2018-05-27T13:42:19Z: Bottas is past Ocon and into fifth.
2018-05-27T13:40:44Z: Better from Ricciardo on lap 21, but the gap falls to 1.8 seconds.
2018-05-27T13:40:25Z: Having let Hamilton past very, very easily not long ago, Ocon is very soon going to have Bottas on his tail for fifth.
2018-05-27T13:40:16Z: Vettel takes more than a second out of Ricciardo next time around. The lead is down to 2.4s now. Hmm...
2018-05-27T13:40:01Z: But now Vandoorne makes his first pitstop and lets Verstappen escape into 11th, behind Alonso.
2018-05-27T13:39:46Z: Vandoorne holds Verstappen off again at the chicane. Verstappen is now 48s behind his race-leading team-mate and still hasn't pitted.
2018-05-27T13:39:14Z: Sirotkin makes his first pitstop that isn't a penalty, which will put him back down to 19th.
2018-05-27T13:38:55Z: Alonso pits, moving Bottas back into the top six. Alonso comes out just ahead - literally only just - of Vandoorne and Verstappen.
2018-05-27T13:38:27Z: The pace is slow in the early laps on ultrasofts - Ricciardo does a 1m18.0s, having been capable of mid-1m15s on the hypersofts before he stopped. Vettel only takes two tenths out of him though, so he's struggling as well.
2018-05-27T13:37:50Z: Verstappen is up to 12th with Sainz having stopped, but is still stuck behind Vandoorne - and has a lot of cars quite close behind him who've pitted, which the Red Bull hasn't.
2018-05-27T13:37:09Z: The stewards won't be making things any worse for Williams - they declare 'no further action' over the penalty investigation.
2018-05-27T13:36:45Z: After his pitstop, Bottas is 3s behind Alonso in seventh place and likely to close quickly.
2018-05-27T13:36:27Z: Ericsson and Magnussen pit, they rejoin in the same order and clear of Sirotkin and Grosjean.
2018-05-27T13:35:55Z: Sensible call from Red Bull - it had a gap back to Vettel, but it makes sense to cover off what the cars behind were doing, and Ricciardo maintains track position. We're only on lap 17/78 though - a long way to go.
2018-05-27T13:34:53Z: Ricciardo pits, and Raikkonen comes in as well.
2018-05-27T13:34:49Z: The strugglign Sainz pits, releasing Perez, Gasly and Hulkenberg. The Renault rejoins ahead of Hartley in 15th.
2018-05-27T13:34:22Z: Verstappen's eagerness to pass Vandoorne is such that he even has a little look at Tabac.
2018-05-27T13:34:17Z: Ricciardo's pace - once he needed to show it - basically told Ferrari that Vettel's race is with Hamilton today, not the Red Bull for victory.
2018-05-27T13:33:49Z: Grosjean pits, emerging 19th between the Williams.
2018-05-27T13:33:29Z: With Leclerc having pitted, Verstappen is up to 13th and is right on Vandoorne's tail.
2018-05-27T13:33:13Z: Sainz becomes the latest driver to complain about debris at Loews. A more pressing problem is that he's 7s away from Alonso ahead and has Perez, Gasly and Hulkenberg queuing behind him.
2018-05-27T13:32:32Z: Hartley also got an early pitstop out of the way, Leclerc rejoins just behind him in 18th - with the two Williams behind them.
2018-05-27T13:31:39Z: Hamilton has made swift work of Ocon, which prevents the Force India from interfering with his race much. Let's see how his pace compares to Ricciardo and Vettel.
2018-05-27T13:30:28Z: A replay suggests Stroll picked up his damage from running into Leclerc.
2018-05-27T13:30:11Z: Ricciardo pulls the pin and puts in a 1m15.5s to go six tenths quicker than Vettel.
2018-05-27T13:29:19Z: Williams is now being investigated for working on Sirotkin's car while he was in for his penalty.
2018-05-27T13:28:45Z: Hamilton pits! Mercedes the first to blink strategically.
2018-05-27T13:28:12Z: Stroll has to take to the chicane runoff to let a crowd of midfielders past to lap him.
2018-05-27T13:27:46Z: The leaders continue to trade fastest laps - now it's Ricciardo with a 1m16.4s. Vettel fights back in the first sector next time around though, to prevent the gap going above two seconds.
2018-05-27T13:27:22Z: Sirotkin's penalty and Stroll's damage mean Williams is now running in the last two positions, 19th and 20th.
2018-05-27T13:26:40Z: Williams sends Stroll back out with supersoft tyres and a new front wing, but he's last and a lap down.
2018-05-27T13:26:25Z: Ricciardo gets held up slightly as Stroll dives for the pits, while behind him Vettel pumps in a 1m16.6s for a new fastest lap.
2018-05-27T13:25:37Z: Stroll is trundling along slowly with a puncture tyre.
2018-05-27T13:25:16Z: Ricciardo gets in on the act with fastest laps, showing he has some pace if he needs it: 1m16.8s and the lead jumps up to 1.8s.
2018-05-27T13:24:49Z: Verstappen is all over the back of Leclerc through the chicane.
2018-05-27T13:24:34Z: There's a bit of a gap - 2.7s - from Alonso in seventh to Sainz in eighth, and then everyone back to Verstappen in 14th is in one queue.
2018-05-27T13:24:13Z: Ocon is currently in that very lonely best of the rest place Magnussen occupied in Spain - he's sixth, 6s behind Bottas ahead but 6s ahead of Alonso behind.
2018-05-27T13:24:03Z: Fastest lap for both Vettel and Hamilton! 1m16.998s for Vettel, followed by a 1m16.988s for the Mercedes. Ricciardo puts in a 1m17.1s - he leads Vettel by 1.3s.
2018-05-27T13:23:32Z: Verstappen quickly passes Hartley too to take 14th place.
2018-05-27T13:23:21Z: Sirotkin rejoins 20th and last, 20s behind 19th-placed Grosjean. Ouch.
2018-05-27T13:22:37Z: Sirotkin pits to serve that painful penalty.
2018-05-27T13:22:29Z: And now Verstappen scythes past Stroll with an outbraking dive into the seafront chicane. That's 16th place secured, Hartley next up.
2018-05-27T13:22:05Z: Stroll is going to be very aware of Verstappen in his mirrors - the Red Bull jinking around optimistically everywhere.
2018-05-27T13:21:32Z: Sirotkin is given a 10s stop/go penalty for that grid infringement, that'll drop him back from 12th.
2018-05-27T13:21:18Z: Another fastest lap for Vettel - 1m17.321s. He was only one tenth faster than Ricciardo that time.
2018-05-27T13:21:00Z: Next target for Verstappen is Lance Stroll, who's 16th and close behind Hartley and Charles Leclerc ahead.
2018-05-27T13:20:03Z: Though Verstappen's gained three places, he's already 23s behind race-leading team-mate Verstappen after six laps.
2018-05-27T13:19:27Z: Verstappen makes it past Marcus Ericsson with a neat dive into Mirabeau. Up to 17th.
2018-05-27T13:19:02Z: Fastest lap for Vettel - 1m17.488s. Ricciardo's lead drops to 1.2s.
2018-05-27T13:17:35Z: The other part of Ricciardo's job is obviously building a lead, which he continues to do, heading Vettel by 1.5s on lap four.
2018-05-27T13:17:32Z: Fernando Alonso in seventh has already dropped away dramatically from Esteban Ocon ahead - that gap 3.4s by lap four.
2018-05-27T13:16:19Z: A replay of the start shows Verstappen made it around the outside of both the Haas drivers at Sainte Devote.
2018-05-27T13:15:25Z: Midfield order: 11 Hulkenberg; 12 Sirotkin; 13 Vandoorne; 14 Leclerc; 15 Hartley; 16 Stroll; 17 Ericsson; 18 Verstappen; 19 Magnussen; 20 Grosjean
2018-05-27T13:14:58Z: Despite declaring that his wing was broken, Hartley has stayed out and continues in 15th place.
2018-05-27T13:14:32Z: Order: 1 Ricciardo; 2 Vettel; 3 Hamilton; 4 Raikkonen; 5 Bottas; 6 Ocon; 7 Alonso; 8 Sainz; 9 Perez; 10 Gasly
2018-05-27T13:14:30Z: Ricciardo ends the opening lap with a lead of 1.1s over Vettel.
2018-05-27T13:13:56Z: By the Loews hairpin, Verstappen has cleared both Haases to reach 18th.
2018-05-27T13:13:44Z: The full field gets around Sainte Devote with no tail-end dramas, and no progress for Verstappen yet.
2018-05-27T13:13:36Z: Ricciardo fends off a fast starting Vettel to hold the lead into Turn 1, with Hamilton, Raikkonen and Bottas slotting in behind. Vettel has a little sniff up the hill to Massenet, but that's not happening.
2018-05-27T13:13:00Z: The Monaco Grand Prix is go!
2018-05-27T13:12:45Z: Just waiting for Verstappen to slot into place.
2018-05-27T13:12:30Z: The last runners are coming around Rascasse.
2018-05-27T13:11:45Z: Problem for Sirotkin - who's had a very impressive weekend - as a last-minute wheel problem meant he didn't have all four wheels on the car at the three-minutes-to-go point as required in the rules. Race control is investigating, a penalty could be coming.
2018-05-27T13:11:05Z: Grid line-up:1 Ricciardo2 Vettel3 Hamilton4 Raikkonen5 Bottas6 Ocon7 Alonso8 Sainz9 Perez10 Gasly11 Hulkenberg12 Vandoorne13 Sirotkin14 Leclerc15 Hartley16 Ericsson17 Stroll18 Grosjean19 Magnussen20 Verstappen
2018-05-27T13:10:20Z: The field sets off on the formation lap.
